comments.body: Great idea! I was thinking of posting something akin to this idea but then I saw that it was already posted: you have a very creative mind sir. I hope that your Armor Stand idea gets added to the game. Additionally, Minecraft Bedrock and Minecraft Java have too many differences right now, Armor stand variants would help stabilize these differences. :D
Most definitely do that!
True, and I hate that.
They need to do that to bedrock to

You can turn cheats off again in Java.  On Bedrock, if you want to place a command block to stop mob griefing, or /give yourself a dragon egg because you lost yours in the void, you have to turn off achievements.  Maybe there could be a system/website where you can write a letter to Mojang, and they'll allow just that one command without turning off achievements.  If it's okay, could you help support my post for Mojang to stop ignoring bedrock edition here?
Im gutted this feature isn't on bedrock! I've wanted it for years, please add it to bedrock, possibly one of the things I want most in the game üòÇ
Si yo tambi√©n
Im wanting this also

Y‚Äôall need to put all the Java features in bedrock and all bedrock features in Java so no one will miss out on the fun of Minecraft that‚Äôs why most people hate it cause of that just merge Java and bedrock
I would love this soo much! I really want to build an infinity room!
Also, if netherite is immune to the wither, so should ancient debris.
there should be a block that prevents withers from destroying obsidian, called the wither debuffer.
hmm, this may be a bit overpowered
Maybe snowfall can layer up to 3, but anything beyond that must be player-added.
I like the current behaviour.
I don't build in snow biomes for that reason, so I fully agree with the developers to change that.

I agree with this, if Minecraft wants full parity, they should either add the baby dolphins to java or remove the baby dolphins from bedrock. Breeding dolphins should also be fine IMO if every other animal can be bred no problem, just have them breed on their own if players doing it is too far for some reason.
Baby dolphins are cute!
Ereddrr
Hallo Minecraft ich hoffe dir geht's gut
this is a good idea.
Why thank you.
Oh yeah, totally agree.
good idea!

Agree, those dungeons mobs are so cool, so beautiful, so artistic!
In Java Minecraft, you can place flower pots anywhere. They don't need support.
I would love this feature! As a bedrock player who likes to build, I come into this problem quite often. Also, I think it should be able to float.
Also, item frames cant be placed next to each other on a corner

Good idea I'm playing on only Bedrock Edition and will get 6 mayor updates in total this year 1.8, 1.9, 1.10, 1.11, 1.12, 1.13. The first four was Village and Pillage, the fifth was map making and bug fixes, and the sixth is adding Java Edition exclusive features.
Now both Java and Bedrock are only getting one major update a year, like 1.21 in 2024, 1.20 in 2023.

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.
Why not improve performance without removing features?
@tryashtar because you can't have both. If you have more stuff on screen, more polygons have to be rendered, more ram and cpu time have to be used. That is just the way it is.
In that case let's remove all mobs because they are harmful to performance

But why ? It's much better to have them in entities than blocks because it allows so much more stuff for mapmakers.
And honestly item frames are definitely not the thing that cause the more lag so it won't make a lot of difference.
I think it's much better as it is now. I really don't know why you guys really want to simply remove features.

But I really like being able to put multiple item frames in a single block space, and as long as you don't have them all over your house it won't cause a lot of lag unless you have a really really bad computer.
try lowering your graphics settings, that generally works

I think it should be the other way around. Make item frames entities in bedrock. I used to place torches and item frames in the same block for a little bit of detail on legacy console but now I can't do that.

(side note) Bedrock invisible item frames would be nice as well
so many cool things are possible with the way they are now though..

That's a terrible idea, the peformance concern isn't that bad and block entities already cause lag anyways, even if it's less than normal entities. One of the coolest things about the item frames on Java is that you can put multiple of them on the same block or put them in the same place as a block, it's great for decoration and it's a shame that this is not in Bedrock.
they will socialise, but not as often as java

The villagers are 100% a straight up mess and borderline unplayable if we‚Äôre telling the truth. I waited ages to mess with them because I knew this to be true, but there comes a time that you need or want a trading hall and you can‚Äôt procrastinate anymore. Setting it up took... forever. And it was the most enraging process I‚Äôve ever engaged in. Which is a shame because the beauty of minecraft is that it‚Äôs the most relaxing game. Like even fighting bosses isn‚Äôt enough to make someone rage quit, but playing with villagers in any capacity, yeah I‚Äôll rage quit.

They really do just wander all around, constantly divorcing their beds and workstations. So they never work to refresh their trades and, again, wonder all around at all hours just begging to be murdered by zombies.

They should be so much fun to play with, building whole towns and things, but they need some serious help.

I also want to point out the terrible linking mechanics of villagers on bedrock edition, they tend to link to workstations they can't pathfind to and just keeps linking/unlinking to it. Villagers on bedrock edition are fustrating to handle near your base with the workstations as decoration.

Villagers on java edition are very well behaved and civilized

When a hostile bee is nearby, villagers will lift their arms into the air, and run around while screaming.

When a player falls into lava, nearby villagers will start doing an evil laugh.

The villagers are why I don't play bedrock.

I like to make large buildings and the bedrock villagers constantly get lost. They Also make noises 24/7 so I can't listen for anyone who is lost at Night.

P.s. the key to skyscrapers in java is three wide spiral staircases no more than 8 to 10 blocks away from each other. The villagers find them easier than regular staircases to pathfind
Anche secondo me la capacita' di poter spaccare I ciottoli dal tridente potrebbe essere aggiunta
Basically, smoke renders in render distance instead of simulation distance. Good suggestion but may be hard to implement.
I like dat idea m8

Please correct this in Bedrock. My volcano's smoke is not seen from a distance and just looks silly.

Why is the campfire programmed to increase the smoke height with a hay bale if that large smoke signal can't been seen a few blocks away?

this really does completely negate the campfires most useful feature, the particles from the fire should render if the campfire is loaded. currently on a bedrock realm a campfire has an effective realm of between 49 and 64 blocks

2025 and still an issue. it would make sense for MINECRAFT / Mojang to fix this considering mounts of mayhem; travel. i say fix, not patch, this is an intentional feature. i think a lot of bedrock players would appreciate this change.

Hope that the render dragon engine will allow shader makers to make better shader for bedrock and come closer to what java has
It already does use OpenGL on mobile (but it uses DirectX on Windows 10 for some reason)
And, preferably, without unnecessary interactions with the hatch, on a separate key / combination.
You can crawl with a water bucket but I would like to be able to with a trapdoor
Especially to make secret entrances in bedrock pretty good Idea
An example is the cherry cape.

and older capes like the "Founders cape," "Progress Pride," and "Pancape" I have then on Bedrock, and they are saved to my Microsoft account, and since they forced Java Players to migrate to Microsoft servers, Java should have the same capes you do on Bedrock.

Or just add a button in the launcher that checks bedrock and Java and syncs inventory together at least.
Ya vote XD BOBICRAFT
BOBICRAFT nadie voto :(

Hardcore in bedrock... that's not bad.

Add this plsss

Have a great Day

Redfire
It‚Äôs well over 5000 upvotes, so we should see it in the near future.
please kasi hardcore mode is Minecraft bedrock #mojang.com Minecraft.net
That would be great but there is a glitch that randomly kills you in bedrock so hat would be annoying but if they fix it than I would love to see bedrock hardcore

I think those exclusive features were added due to the fact that worlds in Legacy Console were not infinite, so it made sense to have things that are only available in fortresses to be everywhere in the Nether, in case there wasn't a fortress in your world.

Wither skeletons always spawned within proximity of a fortress on console, not a huge difference. As for the other features, nether wart could spawn on souls and near the fortresses, and maybe blazes have a lower chance. I still think there should be a better way of obtaining glowstone than just mining it. The nether ends up getting super dark otherwise.
I notice this on Bedrock, and I'd love to have these in Java too! I voted.

I personally think the sound played when jumping is a bit strange (since your feet aren't hitting the ground when you jump upwards, only when landing), but definitely agree that the landing sounds should be added to Java.
